DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , single center , randomize , bilateral crossover , dispense clinical trial evaluate effect water gradient lens , DAILIES TOTAL1 , biology corneal epithelium two month daily wear compare wear control high oxygen permeable silicone hydrogel daily disposable contact lens , ACUVUE TruEye ; correlate change alteration lid wiper , tear film cellular change limbus . The total propose duration study 12 month ensure enrollment 94 establish contact lens wearer , anticipate completion 84 . Data collect baseline follow 2 month daily wear lens type . Based upon data investigator previous contact lens clinical trial , 1 month washout period require prior initiate lens wear eliminate potential residual solution lens effect corneal epithelium restore homeostasis . The study schedule commence upon Institutional Review Board approval .
DOC.detailed_description: The following Standard Care procedures perform study : I.Medical history Concomitant Medication Recorded - Subjects interview demographic , medical ocular History , allergies medication . The study doctor study personnel use paper source document ( Case Report Form ) collect record follow data : current prescription contact lenses glass , refraction , keratometry . II.Comprehensive Exam A. Snellen visual acuity testing ( eye ) This perform use standard projector chart twenty foot . All patient refract ensure visual acuity prescription within inclusion criterion . B. Anterior ocular segment inspection slit lamp examination 1 . Blink rate estimate per minute ( eye ) 2 . Normal eyelid eyelash position check upper low lid ( eye ) 3 . The tear meniscus inspect estimate height millimeter presence absence cell debris include mucous thread ( eye ) 4 . The bulbar conjunctiva , cornea , anterior chamber , iris , crystalline lens inspect abnormality ( eye ) 5 . Meibomian gland orifice inspect sign inflammation plugging ; eyelid skin margin inspect inflammation scaling ( eye ) . C. Aqueous tear production ( eye ) Following application 1 drop topical tetracaine , Schirmer test strip apply low fornix outer one-third low eyelid 3 minute length wet record mm ( ≥ 3.0 mm wetting/3 minute consider within normal limit ) . D. Corneal staining ( eye ) One-drop non-preserved isotonic saline place upon tip fluorescein test strip apply low fornix patient look ; presence absence corneal stain fluorescein note screen clinician . E. Intraocular pressure measurement One drop tetracaine apply cornea gently applanated tip Goldmann tonometer ensure Intraocular pressure ≤ 21 mmHg ( eye ) . F. Evaluation upper low eyelid Both upper eyelid gently evert upper low conjunctival surface inspected abnormality . G. Fundus examination The pupil dilate OU ( eye ) 1 drop 2.5 % neosynephrine 0.15 % mydriacyl apply 1x , X2 , x3 need 10 minute interval achieve > 5 mm dilation OU . The fundus inspect appearance optic nerve , macula , retinal vessel periphery abnormality note . Any abnormality cause non-inclusion . The following Experimental Procedures perform : I . Informed Consent Process The research staff review study include informed consent detail allow subject time make informed decision . Following review opportunity ask question , subject ask sign consent form . II . Tear collection ( eye ) Tear collection perform first clinical test . Three µl sample volume tear collect non-invasively vivo use microcapillary tube inferior tear meniscus temporal canthus eye . Tears collect patient seat slit lamp light low illumination . III . Corneal epithelial cell collection ( left eye ) Corneal epithelial cell collect non-invasively vivo use custom-made ocular irrigation chamber specific type study . The corneal irrigation chamber collect corneal epithelial cell 15 ml test tube . The patient seat forehead rest headrest ; fixation target place orient eye irrigate downwards ; irrigate tip position 2 mm corneal apex . Irrigation involve delivery 9 ml sterile saline central cornea period 1 minute via tube pump . IV . In vivo confocal microscopy ( right eye ) A Heidelberg confocal microscope engineer house remote control scan capability utilize study . One drop topical tetracaine place subject 's eye ; subject 's head place headrest regular slit lamp examination . A drop Genteal ( Alcon Laboratories ) place upon top objective lens serve immersion fluid . The cornea applanated use standard objective lens tip . Both confocal microscopy focus scan static image corneal epithelial surface acquire central cornea four quadrant limbus control patient 's direction gaze . Similar image sequence perform sequentially image upper low lid wiper region midpoint eyelid ( correspond 5 7 o'clock position limbus ) . For upper lid imaging , lid evert prior image acquisition . Sequential image allow subsequent montage generation mid-point upper low lid . Per visit detail : Visit 1 : Screening Visit - Comprehensive ocular examination ( Contact Lens Clinic UTSW ) ( This visit last ~ 90 minute ) 1 . Informed Consent review sign 2 . Medical History Concomitant Meds 3 . Comprehensive examination 4 . Back-up glass order need 5 . Lens fit order base randomization follow lens group : Alcon DAILIES TOTAL1 Johnson Johnson ACUVUE TruEye 6 . One month washout begin Visit 2 : Baseline Visit , lens 1 dispense ( This visit last ~ 60 minute ) 1 . Brief screen exam ( go medical history , medication , slit lamp exam ) 2 . Informed consent re-reviewed 3 . Baseline biological indicator ( outcome measure ) assess Tear collection OU ( OU = eye ) Lid wiper stain OD ( OD = Right eye ) Ocular irrigation ( collect epithelial cell ) OS ( OS = Left eye ) Confocal microscopy cornea , limbus lid margin OD 4 . Lenses dispense Visit 3 : 1 week lens wear ( +/- 3 day ) ( This visit last ~ 30 minute ) 1 . Contact lens check 1 . Lens fit 2 . Slit lamp examination without corneal stain Visit 4 : 2 month lens wear ( +/- 3 day ) ( This visit last ~ 60 minute ) 1 . Brief screen exam ( go medical hx , medication , slit lamp exam ) 2 . Lenses diary collect 3 . Biological indicator assess . Lenses collect OU ii . Tear collection OU iii . Lid wiper stain OD iv . Ocular irrigation OS v. Confocal microscopy cornea , limbus lid margin OD d. Patient begin next 1 month washout period Visit 5 : Baseline visit , lens 2 dispense ( This visit last ~ 60 minute ) . Brief screen exam ( go medical hx , medication , slit lamp exam ) b. Baseline biological indicator assess . Lenses collect OU ii . Tear collection OU iii . Lid wiper stain OD iv . Ocular irrigation OS v. Confocal microscopy cornea , limbus lid margin OD c. Lenses dispense - begin crossover phase Visit 6 : 1 week lens wear ( +/- 3 day ) ( This visit last ~ 30 minute ) . Contact lens check 1 . Lens fit 2 . Slit lamp examination without corneal stain Visit 7 : 2 month lens wear ( +/- 3 day ) ( This visit last ~ 60 minute ) 1 . Brief screen exam ( go medical hx , medication , slit lamp exam ) 2 . Lenses diary collect 3 . Biological indicator assess . Lenses collect OU ii . Tear collection OU iii . Lid wiper stain OD iv . Ocular irrigation OS v. Confocal microscopy cornea , limbus lid margin OD d. Study complete
DOC.criteria: Aged 2138 year Any sex , race national origin accept past study . Minority representation proactively encourage Sign write informed consent A habitual contact lens wearer wear lens daily wear use ( overnight wear ) Myopia range : 1.00 6.00 regular astigmatism ( ≤1 Diopter , eye ) Be willing wear spectacle two 1month washout period Have acceptable fit test lenses willing wear lens duration study . Need correction eye correctable within 3 letter ( high contrast Snellen VA ) current contact lens prescription baseline eye test lens . No history allergic eye disease either seasonal associate previous contact lens wear . A routine screening complete ocular examination ( COE ) ocular finding consider within normal limit . Be willing able follow instruction regard wear daily disposable lens attend schedule followup visit . Must able arrange weekday appointments 8:00 ( morning ) 12:00 ( noon ) . Habitual lens wearer unable wear lens minimum 8 hour per day . Use concurrent ocular medication Habitual toric bifocal contact lens wearer Any previous history keratorefractive surgery recent ocular injury ocular surgery within prior 3 month Any preexist ocular disease Monocular contact lens wear Any systemic disease ocular abnormality may impact optimal contact lens wear Use systemic medication include limited antihistamine , corticosteroid , anticholinergic immunomodulatory agent Pregnancy lactation Concurrent enrollment another clinical trial
